paper.title: Information resource planning: overcoming difficulties in identifying top management's objectives
paper.publisher: Society for Information Management and The Management Information Systems Research Center
paper.abstract: Twenty information resource managers employed by medium to large organizations in diverse industries were interviewed to discover their difficulties in learning top managementu0027s objectives and their techniques for overcoming these difficulties. The thirteen difficulties can be viewed as strategic formulation or strategy communication problems. The sixteen techniques can likewise be viewed as facilitating strategy formulation or strategy communication. The research revealed that participants in strategy formulation have no problem understanding top managementu0027s objectives while information resource managers who do not participate in strategy formulation do experience that problem.
